summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary interview conducted on September 1, 2021, with a Lieutenant from the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The lieutenant was assigned to the Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein was found unresponsive.

connections.description: The Senior Special Agent, along with a Special Agent, conducted a voluntary interview of the BOP Lieutenant as part of the OIG investigation.
The Special Agent, along with a Senior Special Agent, conducted a voluntary interview of the BOP Lieutenant as part of the OIG investigation.
The BOP Lieutenant was a staff member assigned to the Special Housing Unit where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was housed prior to his death.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Lieutenant
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary, recorded interview of a BOP Lieutenant from MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

events.title: Lieutenant's Assignment Prior to Epstein's Death
events.description: The interviewed BOP Lieutenant was assigned to the MCC New York Special Housing Unit, where Epstein was housed, the day before Epstein was found dead.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
Boston Area Office (DOJ OIG Reporting Office)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's death as of September 2021, conducting interviews with prison staff.
A BOP Lieutenant from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit was interviewed regarding the day (August 9, 2019) before Epstein was found dead.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, and the report includes several attachments such as daily rosters, activity reports, and emails from August 2019.
The document is an internal OIG memorandum that states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions, and its contents are not to be distributed outside the receiving agency.
